title-group.article-title: THE CURSE OF DIMENSIONALITY FOR NUMERICAL INTEGRATION OF SMOOTH FUNCTIONS

abstract.p: We prove the curse of dimensionality for multivariate integration of Cr functions: The number of needed function values to achieve an error ùúñ is larger than Cr(1 + Œ≥)d for ùúñ ‚â§ ùúñ‚ÇÄ, where Cr, Œ≥ > 0. The proofs are based on volume estimates for r = 1 together with smoothing by convolution. This allows us to obtain smooth fooling functions for r > 1.
